section.title: Regional Account View
section.para: The Regional Account View option lets you view the account balances of customers' accounts that are linked to your company through a trust relationship set up by the bank administrator.

section.title: Regional Account View - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Regional Account View function, from the tool bar, select Account Services > Account Details.

Alternatively, if the Account Summary, Account Statement or Account Details functions have already been selected, there will be a link to the Regional Account View function in the left hand side navigation list.

section.title: Regional Account View Selection
section.para: When you select this function, the system displays a list of accounts and their balances that you are enabled to view through the trust relationship criteria.

You can filter the list by expanding Search Options and entering the search criteria in the Customer or Equivalent Currency field. To display all customers, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields. Click the Search button to view the result. Click the Download File button to download and save the results on your computer in a Comma-Separated Values (CSV) format file. You can use this file as a report and analyse it or customise it for your requirements.
The search result displays the following columns:

entry.para: Abbreviated customer name and in the brackets, the bank that the customer is linked to.
Regional currency selected to convert the the values from your default currency.

By default, the equivalent currency is your default currency. However, when you change this by selecting the magnifying glass icon to the regional currency, the account balances are converted as per the exchange rate, to the selected currency.
Balance in the account converted in your selected equivalent currency.

note.para: The cumulative total of all the accounts is displayed in the last row in Equivalent Currency and Equivalent Balance.

section.para: You can click and toggle between the Expand all groups and Hide all groups button at the top to view the accounts in each group or hide the list respectively. You can also click and toggle between the [+] and [-] button on the group headers to view or hide the group-specific account information respectively.
